summary: The Hospice Recertification Flexibility Act amends the Social Security Act to extend telehealth flexibilities for hospice care under the Medicare program. It extends the use of telehealth for hospice recertification until December 31, 2027. It also includes exceptions based on geographic areas with moratoriums on hospice enrollment, providers subject to enhanced oversight, and unenrolled hospice physicians or nurse practitioners. Furthermore, it mandates the use of modifiers or codes on hospice claims for telehealth recertification encounters occurring on or after January 1, 2026.
